ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation

Class Localizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation.Localizer

  • public class Localizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides localization functionality, which allows the robot to compute its initial location when placed on the grid.

    The Localizator class combines ultrasonic and light sensor localization into a single routine that corrects the X, Y and Theta values of the odometer to the location of the robot with respect to the grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Localizer

        public Localizer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                 EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                 Navigation navigation,
                 double SENSOR_OFFSET,
                 double TILE_SIZE)
          throws OdometerException,
                 PollerException
        Creates a Localizator that will operate on the singleton Odometer class.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Lower left motor of the robot.
        rightMotor - Lower right motor of the robot.
        navigation - Navigation object to move the robot on the grid.
        SENSOR_OFFSET - Distance between the lower light sensor and the robot's center.
        SENSOR_OFFSET_ANGLE - Angle between the lower light sensor and the robot's center.
        TILE_SIZE - Size of a tile in the grid in centimeters.
        Throws:
        OdometerException - If the Odometer has not been instantiated.
        PollerException - If the UltrasonicPoller of the LightPoller classes have not been instantiated.
        See Also:
        Odometer

    • Method Detail

      • tunnelLocalization

        public void tunnelLocalization()
        Performs localization using two light sensors assuming that the robot just exited a tunnel.

      • localize

        public void localize(long startingCorner,
                     long LL_x,
                     long LL_y,
                     long UR_x,
                     long UR_y)
        Performs falling edge ultrasonic localization to correct the angle Theta of the odometer and then it uses light localization to get the correct values of the X and Y coordinates of the robot's location. The values obtained are used to overwrite the odometer's current values.

        The starting corner parameter is used to adjust the odometer values according the the absolute set of coordinated on the map. The corners are defined using the range [0-3] with 0 being the lower left corner and the range increasing in the counter-clockwise direction.

        Parameters:
        startingCorner - Starting corner of the robot on the grid.
        LL_x - X coordinate of the lower left corner of the robot's team area.
        LL_y - Y coordinate of the lower left corner of the robot's team area.
        UR_x - X coordinate of the upper right corner of the robot's team area.
        UR_y - Y coordinate of the upper right corner of the robot's team area.

      • lightLocalization

        public void lightLocalization(long startingCorner,
                              long LL_x,
                              long LL_y,
                              long UR_x,
                              long UR_y)
        Provides a more accurate set of values for X, Y and Theta to the odometer by using light localization.

        The light localization routine consists of approaching the reference corner and spinning until four line detections are recorded. The the angles recorded during the line detections are used to correct the odometer values.

        This method requires that the robot is placed around the middle of a tile and that the odometer knows the angle of the robot to some degree of accuracy. A reference corner and its coordinates must be provided to use to do the localization. The corners are encoded using the range [0-3] with 0 being the the upper right corner of the tile where the robot lies, and the range increasing in the counter-clockwise direction.

        Parameters:
        startingCorner - Starting corner of the robot on the grid.
        LL_x - X coordinate of the lower left corner of the robot's team area.
        LL_y - Y coordinate of the lower left corner of the robot's team area.
        UR_x - X coordinate of the upper right corner of the robot's team area.
        UR_y - Y coordinate of the upper right corner of the robot's team area.
